title: Vitamin B1 (Thiamine)
overview: Vitamin B1, also known as Thiamine, is a white to almost white crystalline powder, essential for carbohydrate metabolism and normal nerve function. It plays a pivotal role in energy production by helping convert carbohydrates into usable energy and supports the proper functioning of the heart, muscles, and nervous system. Thiamine is widely used in pharmaceutical formulations, nutraceutical supplements, and fortified food products to prevent and treat thiamine deficiency.

specifications.value: White to almost white crystalline powder

features: Essential water-soluble vitamin for energy metabolism
Highly stable and suitable for various dosage forms
Compatible with both pharmaceutical and food applications
Available in different salt forms (mononitrate, hydrochloride)
Excellent bioavailability and proven safety profile

applications.title: Pharmaceutical
applications.description: Used in tablets, capsules, and injections to treat or prevent thiamine deficiency and associated disorders

applications.title: Nutraceutical/Food
applications.description: Added to dietary supplements, multivitamins, and fortified food products to support overall health and wellbeing
